com.mousebird.maply

Class MultiplexTileSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mousebird.maply.MultiplexTileSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    QuadImageTileLayer.TileSource

    public class MultiplexTileSource
extends java.lang.Object
implements QuadImageTileLayer.TileSource
    The multiplex tile source takes a list of remote tile info objects for the purpose of fetching multiple frames per tile. These are used by quad image layers that need to animate between frames.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean debugOutput
      Set this if you'd like full debugging output while loading
      RemoteTileSource.TileSourceDelegate delegate
      Set this delegate to get callbacks when tiles load or fail to load.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiplexTileSource

        public MultiplexTileSource(MaplyBaseController inController,
                           RemoteTileInfo[] inSources,
                           CoordSystem inCoordSys)
        Construct with a list of tile sources. One source per frame and each source needs to be identical in size and min/max zoom levels.

    • Method Detail

      • getDepth

        public int getDepth()
        Return the number of individual sources and/or frames.

      • setCacheDir

        public void setCacheDir(java.io.File inCacheDir)
        Set the cache directory for fetched images. We'll look there first. There is no limiting or pruning going on, that directory will just get bigger and bigger.

        By default that directory is null.

        Parameters:
        inCacheDir - Cache directory for image tiles.

      • getCoordSystem

        public CoordSystem getCoordSystem()
        Returns the coordinate system for the remote tiles.

      • startFetchForTile

        public void startFetchForTile(QuadImageTileLayerInterface layer,
                              MaplyTileID tileID,
                              int frame)
        Description copied from interface: QuadImageTileLayer.TileSource
        This tells you when to start fetching a given tile. When you've fetched the image you'll want to call loadedTile(). If you fail to fetch an image call that with nil.
        Specified by:
        startFetchForTile in interface QuadImageTileLayer.TileSource
        Parameters:
        layer - The layer asking for the fetch.
        tileID - The tile ID to fetch.
        frame - If the source support multiple frames, this is the frame. Otherwise -1.
